meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The car screeched to a stop at the red light.
meanings.sent2: The owl screeched in the night, startling everyone.
meanings.sent3: The teapot screeched happily as it boiled on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The brakes screeched like a banshee as the car skidded on the wet road.
meanings.sent5: Her voice screeched with excitement when she won the race.

meanings.sent1: The screeched of the chalk on the blackboard was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The screeched of the brakes echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The screeched of the seagulls overhead made the beach feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The screeched of the violin filled the concert hall with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The screeched of the alarm clock woke him up abruptly.
